jobs.description:
Operations is at the heart of Amazon’s business. We are known for our speed, accuracy, and exceptional service. Our buildings deliver tens of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, every day. Reliability Maintenance & Engineering (RME) are the business partners that work tirelessly behind the scenes to make it all happen. We drive continuous improvement, and maintain all of the Robotics and Material Handling Equipment (MHE) to ensure our customers are met with the Amazon smile. Come join us on our journey!

About the Role:

As a Senior Mechatronics & Robotics Technician, you will lead service technicians in the installation and repair of automated packaging and distribution equipment. You will support the Operations Maintenance team by designing solutions for difficult problems and managing projects. You will help train and mentor service technicians and contract technicians.

What Do We Offer?
Amazon offers competitive compensation packages including comprehensive healthcare benefits starting on Day 1, matching 401(k) program, and up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave. But wait, there is more: We provide lightweight fire-resistant daily wear and composite toe safety shoes for your safety!


Key job responsibilities
Key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

- You will maintain and oversee material handling equipment (MHE) and facility equipment, such as Fire Life Safety (FLS) systems
- You will lead a team of service technicians and develop training plans, as well as oversee vendors making planned and emergency repairs
- You will install, maintain, and troubleshoot relay logic, ladder diagrams, control components, photo-eyes, motor starters, limit switches, proximity sensors, solenoids, etc.
- You will create and close out work orders with data including labor hours, equipment maintenance, and parts used, as well as develop job plans for emergency repair of critical assets-
- You must be able to move up to 49lbs, stand and walk during shifts lasting up to 12 hours, climb ladders and gangways safely, and without limitation, as well as perform regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head
Please note that while we strive to accommodate employees' preferences for shift assignments, due to operational requirements and scheduling constraints, we cannot guarantee a specific shift assignment.

jobs.description:
Zappos is looking for an analytical and creative individual with experience in fashion ecommerce and knowledge of current footwear trends for a Site Merchandiser position.

This role would be responsible for curating and merchandising assortments to support features, campaigns, and additional emails as well as maintaining both seasonal and evergreen assortments across the site to promote discovery. This person will ensure Zappos offers an exceptional customer shopping experience through our merchandising strategy. They demonstrate exceptional attention to detail and execute product placement, visibility of key items, and priority ordering of all applicable pages with autonomy. They are proficient in excel and has the ability to quickly learn how to navigate new programs. The Site Merchandiser works well under pressure and have the ability to quickly pivot when needed, and are able to handle multiple and competing priorities and adhere to deadlines.

The role is 100% onsite in office (Madison, WI or New York).


Key job responsibilities
• Validate all site assortments, including product categories, brand pages, trend assortments, and special promotions.
• Execute product placement, visibility of key items, and priority ordering of all applicable pages.
• Curate assortments to support featured stories and additional promotional emails.
• Maintain seasonal and trend assortments to support large campaigns and promote discovery.
• Provide site linking based on feature creative and copy that aligns with current merchandising strategy.
• Leverage site analytics to understand performance and customer interactions with brands, categories, and other assortments.
• Identify and work with cross functional partners to resolve any issues that may arise.
• Manage additional special products as needed.

jobs.description:
Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers, high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced ground breaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV, Amazon Echo and Amazon Show. The Amazon Devices group delivers delightfully unique Amazon experiences, giving customers instant access to everything, digital or physical. We are looking for a highly motivated Test Development Engineer to provide technical expertise for manufacturing and testing Amazon’s next generation of devices and bring new test methodologies to fruition.

Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Key job responsibilities
As a Manufacturing Test Engineer, you’ll have a unique opportunity to shape the development and future of the AME Manufacturing Test team. In this role you will innovate and solve problems of high ambiguity and high impact. You will drive design choices, trade-offs, priorities and timelines that align with overall project goals. You will demonstrate exceptional technical expertise, and practical experience designing factory test solutions. You are data and metric driven, and consistently strive for optimal performance even in resource-constrained situations. You will guide and inspire other engineers, participate in defining our engineering culture, and help to build a world class team.

Follow this link view more Amazon Device opportunities within our Operations and Supply Chain teams: https://www.amazon.jobs/content/en/teams/devices-services/operations-supply-chain

A day in the life
As a Sr Manufacturing Test Engineer you’ll be expected to:
• Design and Develop test solutions and test-setup prototypes for new technologies
• Work collaboratively with engineering and operations partners
• Serve as a test lead on cross-functional projects with significant bottom-line impact
• Ensure the quality and execution of our manufacturing test systems
• Lead test design and drive test coverage reviews with engineering teams and CMs.
• Proactively communicate technical information and status to broad, cross-functional teams via weekly updates
• Functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions
• Understand system inter-dependencies and limitations
• Travel to development and build sites in Seattle and Asia to support NPI activities.
• Work with contract manufacturing test teams to ensure test line readiness for NPI build events.

About the team
Joining the AME Manufacturing Test team gives you the opportunity to:
• Innovate the next generation manufacturing solutions for Amazon Devices
• Participate in the architecture, design, development and launch of some of the core product features for customers
• Drive all of the factory test coverage requirements and mass production testing.
• Working collaboratively with MTM and MDE teams to converge on factory line layout.
• Solve challenging problems that will revolutionize manufacturing and test
• Build diversity and inclusion circumstances to promote innovation, creativity, and problem-solving.
The ideal candidate will have experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous product development efforts. You’ll strive for simplicity, and demonstrate significant creativity and high judgment.

jobs.description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides companies of all sizes with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud (“Cloud Computing”). With AWS you can requisition compute power, storage, and many other services – gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as your business demands them. AWS is the leading platform for designing and developing applications for the cloud and is growing rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform.

Join us in building on AWS, for AWS!

The Sales, Marketing, and Global Services Organizations' AWS Investments team is looking for a passionate, innovative, results-oriented Senior Technical Product Manager to define and drive the strategy and direction for services, making it simpler for our field team to manage, maintain and operate at scale. We will provide products and solutions that help give our talented selling and marketing teams “superpowers” that let them focus on the customer and helping them drive their business. We’re handling massive scale, providing strategic data that drives the AWS business internally, and supporting one of the largest field sales organizations in the world.

About the Team
The AWS Investments team operates at the intersection of technology, finance, and global sales strategy, managing billions in programmatic, contractual, and operational investments that drive AWS customer acquisition and growth worldwide. We build and operate mission-critical financial systems that enable hundreds of investment programs across AWS globally, ensuring compliance, operational excellence, and strategic impact. We simplify and accelerate program creation and management, allowing large enterprises to go-to-market, faster.
The Opportunity
We are seeking an exceptional Senior Product Manager - Technical to own the product lifecycle for three interconnected investment management platforms that are fundamental to AWS's go-to-market strategy. This role requires a unique combination of deep technical expertise, financial systems knowledge, and the ability to navigate complex organizational dynamics across AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services.
What You'll Own
You will be the single-threaded owner responsible for managing the complete product lifecycle of three critical products:
Cash App - Supporting billions in programmatic and contractual investment through hundreds of programs across AWS globally, enabling deal support, promotional funding, and strategic customer investments.
Credits App - Managing billions in programmatic, contractual, and operational investment through hundreds of programs worldwide, facilitating AWS service credits for customer acquisition, retention, and expansion.
Global Risk and Compliance Function - Ensuring all investment activities meet financial, legal, and regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions while maintaining operational efficiency and audit readiness.
What You'll Do
Product Strategy & Execution
• Define and own the product roadmap and feature priorities for three interconnected products, contributing to OP1/OP2 narratives and engineering organization roadmaps
• Manage the complete product lifecycle from concept through delivery, working independently with limited guidance
• Define problems we're solving, desired customer experience, vision, tenets, and product strategy for complex financial systems
• Make smart trade-offs between time, effort, and features while ensuring products meet compliance and operational requirements
• Drive product discussions with executives (technical and non-technical), creating product materials and training content
Technical Leadership
• Understand the end-to-end architecture of Amazon Financial Systems, Payment networks, Commerce Platform, and their integration points
• Define APIs, algorithms, and identify where architectural changes are needed to create the right customer and business experience
• Recognize when technical design limits performance, scale, extensibility, and our ability to innovate for customers
• Articulate when new services are needed (and when they are not), working with engineering teams across organizational boundaries
• Assess emerging technologies and their application to investment management use cases
Cross-Organizational Collaboration
• Work with business stakeholders across Sales, Marketing, Global Services, Finance, Legal, and Compliance teams
• Navigate complex integrations with Go-To-Market tools, Salesforce, AWS Marketplace, and core sales processes
• Distill clear requirements from diverse sets of customers, partners, vendors, and regional business entities
• Build consensus across technical and business strategies, aligning stakeholders on approach and prioritization
• Partner with TPMs, engineering teams, and business leaders to ensure cohesive end-to-end solutions
Business Impact & Metrics
• Develop product plans with clear, measurable success criteria
• Define mechanisms and metrics (KPIs, funnels, conversion, awareness) to track product adoption and performance
• Impact product brand, customer experience, technical design trade-offs, and organizational business goals
• Establish and simplify processes to ensure products meet customer needs through effective roadmap prioritization
• Create audit mechanisms for metrics, reporting, and evaluation standards
Risk Management & Compliance
• Proactively mitigate risks and reduce exposure to classic failure modes in financial systems
• Ensure products meet financial, legal, and regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions
• Define showstoppers related to product quality, ensuring issues are resolved in the right order
• Manage post-launch support, triage, and issue management for mission-critical financial systems
Basic Qualifications
• 5+ years of engineering, product management, or relevant experience
• Demonstrated experience managing technology products or major features with considerable business impact
• Strong technical understanding sufficient to work credibly with engineering teams on complex systems
• Experience with financial systems, payment networks, or commerce platforms
• Proven ability to handle complex product development scenarios with visible risks, roadblocks, and constraints
• Track record of successfully driving engineering teams to deliver on product vision
• Experience working with cross-functional teams including engineering, finance, legal, and compliance
Preferred Qualifications
• Deep institutional knowledge of Amazon Financial Systems, Payment networks, and Commerce Platform
• Experience with Go-To-Market tools, Salesforce, and AWS Marketplace integrations
• Understanding of AWS sales processes and how they interoperate with data systems and tools
• Experience managing products supporting $1B+ in transaction volume
• Proven ability to influence technical priorities and business strategy through data-driven contributions
• Experience with global compliance requirements and risk management frameworks
• Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
• Experience contributing to OP1/OP2 planning processes [10,29]
• Track record of building consensus across multiple organizational boundaries
• Experience with agile software engineering practices and best practices for full software development lifecycle
Technical Expectations for Senior PMT
• Understands the reasons behind product/feature architecture decisions and can articulate why systems are built certain ways
• Capable of holding engineering teams to high standards for product solutions (similar to a technical manager)
• Recognizes when technical design limits a product's performance, ability to scale, and future innovation capability
• Able to discern which solutions require additional technical guidance from senior engineers or subject matter experts
• Understands the impact of technical backlog on product future and development team execution
• Knows how to prioritize operational excellence work alongside feature delivery on roadmaps
• Can assess emerging technologies and apply them to product/feature use cases
Key Competencies
Scope and Influence
• Manages multiple products with major features
• Influences strategic direction (business and technology) and engineering organization priorities
• Impacts team engineering roadmaps (internal/external), segment adoption, and organizational business goals
Communication
• Drives product discussions including vision, goals, tenets, narratives, MBR/QBR, and status updates with executives
• Contributes to OP1 planning processes
• Creates product materials and sales/training content
• Produces clear, concise documents including PR/FAQs and technical specifications
Execution
• Works to deliver the right product through tactical and strategic approaches
• Defines features, business, and technology strategy
• Aligns stakeholders across complex organizational structures
• Makes smart trade-offs and may own launch/issue response
• Mentors others and performs PMT assessments
Why This Role Matters
The AWS Investments team enables AWS's growth by providing the financial tools and systems that support customer acquisition, retention, and expansion strategies. Your work will directly impact how AWS invests billions of dollars to drive customer success, requiring you to balance technical excellence, financial rigor, compliance requirements, and operational efficiency at global scale.
Amazon Leadership Principles
Success in this role requires strong demonstration of Amazon's Leadership Principles, particularly:
• Customer Obsession - Understanding both internal and external customer needs
• Ownership - Taking end-to-end responsibility for three critical products
• Invent and Simplify - Finding elegant solutions to complex financial and technical challenges
• Dive Deep - Understanding systems at architectural and implementation levels
• Deliver Results - Driving outcomes in a high-stakes, high-visibility environment
• Think Big - Defining long-term vision for investment management at AWS scale
• Earn Trust - Building credibility across technical, business, and compliance stakeholders

jobs.description:
Project Kuiper is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.

Export Control Requirement: Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

As PCBA Aerospace Manufacturing Test Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for deployment, qualification, continuous improvement of test systems, processes, and procedures at CM (Contract Manufacturing) sites for Satellite PCBAs. You will be a key member of PCBA Manufacturing team and will be the main interface between Amazon Leo internal test development teams and our manufacturing partners. You will ensure successful test deployment by working with your team to document procedures, train CM personnel, and providing ongoing support. You will have extensive debugging experience with the ability to dive deep, determine the root-cause of a test failures, and train others to do the same.

Key job responsibilities
• Develop test strategies, implement and optimize test setup/processes at Contract Manufacturing sites including identification, specification, design and qualification of test fixtures, test equipment, and maintenance programs.
• Work with the R&D and Test Development teams to continuously improve test systems, software, fixtures, and procedures to improve test effectiveness and throughput.
• Analyze data to identify failure trends and provide recommendations PCBA, process, and test system improvement.
• Develop procedures and documentation for use by test operators.
• Train operators on test processes and support recurring certification programs.
• Perform PCBA debug and root-cause failure analysis at Contract Manufacturing sites. Create runbooks and provide training for technicians to perform PCBA debug.
• Provide feedback to the Test Development team on test coverage, fault isolation capability, PCBA failure trends, and DFT (Design for Test) recommendations.
• Work with your team to accomplish short-term objectives and implement strategic initiatives.

A day in the life
Come solve the difficult and rewarding engineering challenges in developing a highly reliable, power efficient, high performance, low-cost satellite system. As a Sr. PCBA Aerospace Manufacturing Test Engineering Manager, you have the ability to dive deep on the details to identify, understand and solve difficult technical problems and also utilize a system level approach to prioritize issues for the whole program. You thrive in a hands-on environment and will spend time in the office, on the factory floor at manufacturing partners, and in the lab to execute the Amazon Leo's mission.

About the team
The PCBA Aerospace Manufacturing Test Engineering team delivers and deploys test systems to our CM's for all Amazon Leo satellite PCBAs. This is an inclusive, inter-disciplinary team that is committed to performance, quality, & reliability. Your breadth of exposure will be immense as you collaborate with other core groups, helping to guide the test systems from design to production and operation.

jobs.description:
Our WW Operations network delivers millions of packages and smiles to Amazon customers every day. We are looking for motivated, customer-focused individuals who want to join our team as an Area Manager. In this role, you will lead a team of hourly workforce and will be responsible for engaging your team during their shifts to maintain the highest levels of safety, quality, attendance, and performance. You will also play a key role in maintaining our customer expectations to ensure customer orders are delivered at the right time, to the right location.

Our Operation’s workflow has three major components: First mile - where the product is housed and ready for order; Middle mile - where the order is hauled to your area; and Last mile - when the product is delivered to the customer’s door. Please note that all workflows have slight building variations, but one thing is constant: our vision and dedication to the customer.

Key job responsibilities
* Support, mentor, and motivate your hourly workforce
* Manage safety, quality, productivity, and customer delivery promises
* Collaborate with all support teams including Safety, Engineering, Loss Prevention, Quality Assurance, Human Resources to develop plans to meet business objectives
* Lift up to 49 pounds and frequently push, pull, squat, bend, and reach
* Stand/walk for up to 12 hours during shifts
* Work in an environment where the noise level varies and can be loud
* Work in an environment that is subject to variable temperatures and weather (delivery stations include outside loading departments)
* Continuously climb and descend stairs (applies to sites with stairs)

Our fulfillment network launches new Operations sites every year, providing various opportunities for your professional growth. We hire Area Managers based on location preference and the business’ current openings.

jobs.description:
*This role is located in Tempe, AZ and is fully on site. No relocation assistance is provided for this role.*

Amazon’s ROC, Team is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Transportation Specialist to assist in the resolution of stakeholder issues of daily freight movements flowing into and out of our North American fulfillment centers and our associated fulfillment network. This is an exciting opportunity to join our team, and to have a positive impact on Amazon, our transportation partners and ultimately our customers. When network disruptions happen, you’ll be at the forefront of helping the network/transportation partners clear those issues and ensure our customers get shipments on time.

An ideal candidate has a background in customer service/call center, transportation, and/or supply chain environments. Additionally, a passion for quickly providing solutions and resolution to challenges by using strong communication, problem solving and organizational skills is a must. Successful candidates will enjoy working in a fast-pace, high-volume environment with a lot of growth opportunity. They will thrive on accountability to themselves, team, carriers/drivers and work schedules!




Key job responsibilities
• Deliver great carrier and driver experience/solutions, in a contact center environment, through researching, problem-solving, setting appropriate expectations and working within the Amazon Transportation network
• Work in fast-paced environment, and adhere to schedules: start/stop, and breaks/lunches
• Support workload surges and/or weather-related operations as needed to include working significant overtime during designated high-volume peaks
• Use internal systems to gather data from multiple sources to support reporting on a daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly basis (AAP, Reach, Decisiv, FMC & YMS)
• Work with cross-functional teams. Use analytical skills to drive data-driven decision, and effectively communicate insights to others across Transportation Operations Management (TOM), Amazon Freight Partners (AFP), and Fleet.
• Provide support to field teams in driver assignment, load acceptance and driver/equipment availability
